abstract: Editorial holds that the Obama administration was wise to suspend part of its health reform geared toward long-term care, because the program was not financially sustainable; asserts, however, that the problem of affordable long-term care is not going away and will have to be tackled eventually.
snippet: The Obama administration was wise to suspend part of its health reform geared toward long-term care, but the problem isn’t going away.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration was wise to suspend part of its health reform geared toward long-term care, but the problem isn’t going away.

headline.seo: The Class Program Didn’t Add Up
